title: Expanding Access to In Vitro Fertilization

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the administration to improve access to in vitro fertilization (IVF) by lowering costs and removing unnecessary barriers to treatment. It instructs a policy review within 90 days to recommend ways to make IVF more affordable and accessible for couples facing infertility.
potential_concerns: Reducing regulatory barriers too aggressively could compromise patient safety or the quality of IVF treatments.
Lowering costs without clear funding mechanisms might shift financial burdens to insurers or healthcare providers, complicating implementation.
The order does not specify protections or oversight for ethical concerns related to IVF access and practices.
Implementation timelines and coordination between agencies may delay or weaken the effectiveness of policy changes.
Potential disparities could arise if affordable IVF access is unevenly distributed regionally or socioeconomically.
